title: Parenting characterized by demand for obedience

content.question: Mr. and Ms. Jones-Smith have five children who range in age from 12 to 2. Their children all follow a tight schedule for meals, studying, chores, and sleep. They are allowed to spend one hour each night playing a complex board game or putting together puzzles. They go on one vacation each year as a family, and the vacation always involves some type of learning experience the children must recall to their parents after the vacation. Which parenting style is characterized by high demands for obedience and low warmth?

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
